overview:
Rob is a leader in innovative strategy specializing in the high tech and digital media industries.

Connonâ€™s career in IT started in 1996 as a software QC engineer, in 1998 he went on to instruct Microsoft Certified Curriculum to emerging Software developers and IT specialists at various private technical institutes in the lower mainland.

In 2001 he was hired by the Vancouver Film School to lead the engineering team as head of systems and network security. Connon left VFS to co-start Packet Safe networks, an internet security, webhosting and consulting company that specializes in technology for digital media and film production companies.

In Late 2003 Mr. Connon was approached by Nerd Corps Entertainment to help build their TV production studio. Connon and his team built an award-winning pipeline and technical infrastructure. The production-proven and bullet-proof IT and software infrastructure has helped Nerd Corps jump to the top of content creation and become a leader in TV and Digital Media Entertainment.

In 2007 Mr. Connon put the building blocks in place for Nerd Corps interactive, a division for digital media and video game production. The Interactive division at Nerd Corps produces vivid web applications and video games to support their high calibre television shows.

In 2008 Connon was brought on board by Dave Geertz and Murray Swales as CTO of the Biracy project, Rob brings many years of application development, product management and business and technology expertise to the team.
